content.heading: Very Brief Testimony
content.p: I had attended a traditional protestant church all my life, but only really to please my parents. When I left for college, I was away from the authority that had kept me from doing those stupid things. I indulged, and after disappointments, divorce, and many bad decisions God had me meet someone who invited me to a church that loved God and taught His ways. After only a few weeks God brought me to the point of knowing that the many self-centered decisions I had made would continue unless I turned my life over to Him. I clearly heard Him say to me at one of the alter calls, "Stand up, this may be your last chance." I needed Him. I stood up and asked Jesus to take control of my decisions and my life. At that point my entire life changed. The bible became alive to me. I could see me in so many of the people and parables. With every decision I submitted to God, I found far more than I could've ever dreamed given to me. He sent me to far off places to proclaim His name and His forgiving grace through song and prayer. I clearly see His hand in every position He has placed me in, spring-boarding me into the next. God continues to teach me and break those little bad habits that still linger. He alone brings the healing forgiveness that I need. His name alone be praised for His abounding love and grace!
content.heading: Favorite Book of the Bible and Why
content.p: Proverbs-because God reveals so much of how He wants me to live through the verses.
content.heading: Favorite Verse and Why
content.p: Proverbs 9:10 "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding." I have seen in my own life and in others that have built a relationship with the Lord become wise as the Lord opens our eyes to see the folly and lies of this world. It's a good thing!
content.heading: Favorite Book (besides the Bible) and Why
content.p: Hudson Taylor's Spiritual Secret This is one of the books that had the greatest impact for me as a new believer. It helped me to see the extent of trust that God wants me to have in Him.
content.heading: Who do you most admire (besides Jesus)
content.p: >I would have to say the Burke's in our own church family. I see Andy and Toni striving to do what God wants in every situation. Because of their faithfulness, even in the toughest situations, I have seen God bless their marriage and their family. God answers their prayers in amazing ways that can't help but impact those around them, believers and unbelievers alike.
content.heading: What do you do at Calvary
content.p: My role at Calvary is to be a conduit for God to move and work through. I am to be supportive and connective. Gentle as a dove, wise as a serpent. I am to be flexible, careful, trusting, and protective.
